required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: ICU-acquired Weakness in Extracorporeal Membrane Oxygenation Support: Frequency and Risk Factors

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: We conducted a retrospective study of critical ill patients who used ECMO during their ICU stay. ICU-AW was diagnosed at the time when patients discharged and had a Medical Research Council (MRC) sum score < 48 out of a maximal score of 60. We divided patients to ICU-acquired weakness group and no ICU-acquired weakness group and compared their clinical characteristics. Baseline characteristics and therapy details were collected from the case report forms and inspection reports. Univariable analysis and logistic regression analysis were used to analyze clinical characteristics of individuals and to find risk factors of ICU-AW.

primary_outcome.measure: Differences between ICU-acquired weakness in patients receiving extracorporeal membrane oxygenation support
primary_outcome.description: We compared the clinical characteristics between ICU-acquired weakness group and no ICU-acquired weakness group by univariate analysis . Then we used logistic regression analysis and found out differences of ICU-acquired weakness.

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency of ICU-acquired weakness in in patients receiving extracorporeal membrane oxygenation support
secondary_outcome.description: We calculated the prevalence of ICU-acquired weakness on the patients included in our research.

arm_group.description: Patients receiving extracorporeal membrane oxygenation support who had a Medical Research Council (MRC) sum score < 48 out of a maximal score of 60 when discharged.
Patients receiving extracorporeal membrane oxygenation support who had a Medical Research Council (MRC) sum score â‰¥ 48 out of a maximal score of 60 when discharged.

study_pop.textblock: There were 85 patients used extracorporeal membrane oxygenationbetween March 2017 to March 2020. Among the 85 patients, 22 patients presented exclusion criteria and 63 patients were included in the final analysis.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Critical ill patients who used extracorporeal membrane oxygenation during their ICU stay. Patients were recruited from the general ICU of the second affiliated hospital of Zhejiang University, between March 2017 to March 2020.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who was less than 18 years old, had been proven or suspected neurological impairment, using extracorporeal membrane oxygenation less than 24 hours, severe head or spinal cord injury and pregnant woman.

patient_data.ipd_description: One year after the article was published, and the opening lasted for one year
